workflow.name: GitHub to Jira bug sync with GPT-4o analysis & team alerts
workflow.description:
# Automate Bug Reports: GitHub Issues ‚Üí AI Analysis ‚Üí Jira Tickets with Slack & Discord Alerts

Automatically convert GitHub issues into analyzed Jira tickets with AI-powered severity detection, developer assignment, and instant team alerts.

## Overview

This workflow captures GitHub issues in real-time, analyzes them with GPT-4o for severity and categorization, creates enriched Jira tickets, assigns the right developers, and notifies your team across Slack and Discord‚Äîall automatically.

## Features

- **AI-Powered Triage**: GPT-4o analyzes bug severity, category, root cause, and generates reproduction steps
- **Smart Assignment**: Automatically assigns developers based on mentioned files and issue context
- **Two-Way Sync**: Posts Jira ticket links back to GitHub issues
- **Multi-Channel Alerts**: Rich notifications in Slack and Discord with action buttons
- **Time Savings**: Eliminates 15-30 minutes of manual triage per bug
- **Customizable Routing**: Easy developer mapping and priority rules

## What Gets Created

**Jira Ticket:**
- Original GitHub issue details with reporter info
- AI severity assessment and categorization
- Reproduction steps and root cause analysis
- Estimated completion time
- Automatic labeling and priority assignment

**GitHub Comment:**
- Jira ticket link
- AI analysis summary
- Assigned developer and estimated time

**Team Notifications:**
- Severity badges and quick-access buttons
- Developer assignment and root cause summary
- Color-coded priority indicators

## Use Cases

- Development teams managing 10+ bugs per week
- Open source projects handling community reports
- DevOps teams tracking infrastructure issues
- QA teams coordinating with developers
- Product teams monitoring user-reported bugs

## Setup Requirements

**Required:**
- GitHub repository with admin access
- Jira Software workspace
- OpenAI API key (GPT-4o access)
- Slack workspace OR Discord server

**Customization Needed:**
1. Update developer email mappings in "Parse GPT Response & Map Data" node
2. Replace `YOUR_JIRA_PROJECT_KEY` with your project key
3. Update Slack channel name (default: `dev-alerts`)
4. Replace `YOUR_DISCORD_WEBHOOK_URL` with your webhook
5. Change `your-company.atlassian.net` to your Jira URL

**Setup Time:** 15-20 minutes

## Configuration Steps

1. Import workflow JSON into n8n
2. Add credentials: GitHub OAuth2, Jira API, OpenAI API, Slack, Discord
3. Configure GitHub webhook in repository settings
4. Customize developer mappings and project settings
5. Test with sample GitHub issue
6. Activate workflow

## Expected Results

- 90% faster bug triage (20 min ‚Üí 2 min per issue)
- 100% consistency in bug analysis
- Zero missed notifications
- Better developer allocation
- Improved bug documentation

## Tags

GitHub, Jira, AI, GPT-4, Bug Tracking, DevOps, Automation, Slack, Discord, Issue Management, Development, Project Management, OpenAI, Webhook, Team Collaboration

workflow.name: Automate Bug Reports: GitHub Issues ‚Üí AI Analysis ‚Üí Jira Tickets with Slack & Discord Alerts

parameters.content:
## üîÑ AUTOMATED BUG WORKFLOW

### Flow: Webhook ‚Üí Filter ‚Üí Extract ‚Üí AI ‚Üí Parse ‚Üí Jira ‚Üí Notify ‚Üí Respond

### Benefits
‚úÖ Instant AI triage
‚úÖ Auto-assignment
‚úÖ Zero manual work
‚úÖ Saves 15-20 min/bug
‚úÖ $685/month ROI

### Setup Requirements
- GitHub repo access
- OpenAI API key (GPT-4o)
- Jira credentials
- Slack workspace (optional)
- Discord server (optional)

## üì• STEP 1: WEBHOOK

**Setup:**
1. Activate workflow
2. Copy webhook URL from this node
3. GitHub ‚Üí Settings ‚Üí Webhooks ‚Üí Add webhook
4. Paste URL
5. Content-type: application/json
6. Events: Select "Issues"
7. Save

**Test:** Create a new issue in GitHub

## üîç STEP 2: FILTER

**Purpose:** Only process NEW issues

**Checks:** action = "opened"
- TRUE: Continue
- FALSE: Stop

**Why:** Prevents duplicate Jira tickets from issue edits, labels, or comments

## üìã STEP 3: EXTRACT DATA

**Extracts:**
- Issue number & title
- Description & reporter
- Labels & URL
- Repository info
- Mentioned files (regex)

**File Detection:**
Finds: .js, .py, .ts, .jsx, .tsx, .java, .go, .rb, .php, .cpp, .c, .css, .html

## ü§ñ STEP 4: AI ANALYSIS

**GPT-4o analyzes:**
- Bug severity (Critical/High/Medium/Low)
- Category (Backend/Frontend/DB/API/UI/etc)
- Reproduction steps
- Potential root cause
- Priority (P0-P3)
- Complexity & time estimate
- Recommended developer

**Setup:** Add OpenAI credentials

**Cost:** ~$0.01-0.03 per issue

## üîß STEP 5: PARSE & MAP

**Functions:**
- Parse AI JSON response (with error handling)
- Map developer types to emails
- Convert priorities (P0‚ÜíHighest)
- Prepare Jira labels array

**‚ö†Ô∏è CUSTOMIZE THIS:**
Update email addresses in the code:
```
"backend-dev": "backend@company.com"
"frontend-dev": "frontend@company.com"
"fullstack-dev": "fullstack@company.com"
"devops": "devops@company.com"
```

## üé´ STEP 6: CREATE JIRA

**Setup:**
1. Add Jira Software Cloud credentials
2. Update YOUR_JIRA_PROJECT_KEY
3. Replace your-company.atlassian.net URLs

**Ticket includes:**
- GitHub issue link
- Original description
- Complete AI analysis
- Auto-assigned developer
- Priority & labels set

**Get API Token:**
Jira ‚Üí Profile ‚Üí Security ‚Üí API Tokens ‚Üí Create

## üîî STEP 7: NOTIFICATIONS

**3 Parallel Branches:**

1Ô∏è‚É£ **GitHub Comment**
- Posts on original issue
- Links to Jira ticket
- Shows AI analysis summary

2Ô∏è‚É£ **Slack Alert**
- Rich formatted message
- All bug details
- Action buttons

3Ô∏è‚É£ **Discord Alert**
- Markdown formatted
- Links to both platforms

All execute simultaneously!

## ‚úÖ STEP 8: RESPOND

**Returns JSON to GitHub:**
```
{
  "status": "success",
  "message": "Bug processed",
  "jiraTicket": "ENG-123"
}
```

**Why important:**
- Confirms processing succeeded
- Prevents GitHub retries
- Shows success in webhook log

**Monitor:**
GitHub ‚Üí Settings ‚Üí Webhooks ‚Üí Recent Deliveries

# üîß TROUBLESHOOTING

**Webhook not triggering?**
‚úÖ Activate workflow first
‚úÖ Check webhook URL copied correctly
‚úÖ Verify "Issues" event selected in GitHub
‚úÖ Test with curl or create test issue

**AI analysis fails?**
‚úÖ Add OpenAI credentials in n8n
‚úÖ Verify API key is valid
‚úÖ Check GPT-4o access on account
‚úÖ Review OpenAI API status

**Jira ticket creation fails?**
‚úÖ Add Jira credentials (email + API token)
‚úÖ Update YOUR_JIRA_PROJECT_KEY
‚úÖ Verify "Bug" issue type exists
‚úÖ Check assignee emails are valid

**Slack notification fails?**
‚úÖ Re-authenticate Slack OAuth
‚úÖ Verify channel name (use "dev-alerts" not "#dev-alerts")
‚úÖ Check bot has permission to post
‚úÖ Invite bot to private channels

**Discord notification fails?**
‚úÖ Verify webhook URL is complete
‚úÖ Test webhook with curl
‚úÖ Check webhook not deleted in Discord

**GitHub comment fails?**
‚úÖ Use GitHub OAuth2 authentication
‚úÖ Verify repo permissions
‚úÖ Check owner/repo names are correct

# üìä ROI CALCULATOR

**Manual Process per Bug:**
- Read & assess: 5 min
- Determine category: 2 min
- Create Jira ticket: 5 min
- Assign developer: 2 min
- Notify team: 2 min
- Update GitHub: 1 min
**Total: 17 minutes**

**Automated Process:**
**6-8 seconds** ‚ö°

**Monthly Savings (50 bugs):**
- Time saved: 825 min (13.75 hrs)
- Labor value: $687.50 (@$50/hr)
- OpenAI cost: ~$2
- **Net savings: $685/month**

**Annual ROI:**
**$8,220 saved per year** üí∞

**Additional Benefits:**
‚úÖ Consistent quality
‚úÖ Zero human error
‚úÖ 24/7 availability
‚úÖ Instant response
‚úÖ Better developer morale

# üé® CUSTOMIZATION IDEAS

**1. Add more developer types:**
Edit Parse GPT Response node:
```javascript
const developerMapping = {
  "backend-dev": "backend@company.com",
  "frontend-dev": "frontend@company.com",
  "mobile-dev": "mobile@company.com",
  "qa-engineer": "qa@company.com",
  "devops": "devops@company.com"
};
```

**2. Filter by severity:**
Add IF node after Parse:
- Only process Critical/High bugs
- Route low-priority to separate flow

**3. Route by channel based on severity:**
```javascript
const channel = severity === 'Critical' 
  ? 'critical-alerts' 
  : 'dev-alerts';
```

**4. Add email notifications:**
Insert Send Email node after Jira
- Email assigned developer
- Include all bug details

**5. Custom Jira labels:**
```javascript
jiraLabels: [
  category,
  severity,
  'auto-triaged',
  `repo-${repositoryName}`
]
```

**6. Multi-repository support:**
Add Switch node after Filter:
- Route different repos to different Jira projects
- Assign to different teams
- Use custom AI prompts per repo

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
